info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 4:04PM PDT until July 18 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Minor flooding or debris flows caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Northern portions of the Bridge Burn Scar in northeast Los Angeles County
* WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos including minor mud or debris flows. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding or debris flows is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional thunderstorms with worsening impacts are possible through early this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wrightwood, Angeles Crest Highway between Mount Waterman and Wrightwood and Big Pines. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING
